var::Message Class Reference

Documentation

The Message Class is used to send and receive data in object notation.

The Message Class formats messages using fmt::Son<4> objects. The messages are sent and received using a device (usually a FIFO but could be sent over a UART or SPI etc).

Here is an example of sending a message.

Message message("/dev/multistream", 256, 2, 3); //read on multistream channel 2 and write on 3
message.create(); //create a blank message
message.write("name", "HelloWorld"); //write a key value pair
message.write("version", "1.0"); //write another pair
message.write("size", 1024);
message.set_timeout(500); //allow the receiver 500ms to receive the message
if( message.send() < 0 ){
printf("Failed to send message\n"); //this happens if no process is ready to read the message
}

To receive a message:

Message message("/dev/multistream", 256, 3, 2);
if( message.recv() > 0 ){
//got a message
var::String value;
message.read_str("name", value);
printf("Name: %s\n", value.c_str()); //name is "HelloWorld"
}

Parameters

Member Function Documentation

virtual int var::Message::create ( )
virtual

Creates a new empty message.

Returns
Zero on success

If a message previously existed, it will be discarded.

int var::Message::edit ( )

Configures the message for editing.

Returns
Zero on success
int var::Message::get_size ( )

Calculates the current size of the message.

Returns
Number of bytes currently occupied by the message.

The message must be in read mode in order to calculate the size.

See read().

bool var::Message::is_open ( ) const
inline

Returns true if device is open.

int var::Message::load ( const char *  path)

Loads a message from a file.

Parameters
pathThe path to load the message file
Returns
Zero on success
int var::Message::read ( )

Configures the message for reading.

Returns
Zero on success
int var::Message::recv ( )

Receives a message on the connection.

Returns
Zero on success
Message message("/dev/multistream", 0, 1, 128);
if( message.recv() == 0 ){
printf("Message number is %d\n", message.read_num("num");
}
int var::Message::save ( const char *  path)

Saves the message to a file in SON format.

Parameters
pathThe path to the file to create
Returns
Zero on success
int var::Message::send ( )

Sends the message over the open connection.

Returns
Zero on success
Message message("/dev/multistream", 0, 1, 128);
message.create();
message.write("name", "Message");
message.close();
if( message.send() < 0 ){
printf("Failed to send message");
}
void var::Message::set_timeout ( int  value)
inline

Sets the timeout in milliseconds.

int var::Message::timeout ( ) const
inline

Returns the timeout in milliseconds.

The timeout defines how many milliseconds to wait before aborting when sending and receiving messages.

The timeout is not absolute. If the channel becomes idle for timeout() milliseconds, the operation is aborted.
